channel.title: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?
channel.description:
So I'm working on a server and I am currently in the research stage of this project, I present to you my latest questions which are based around the economy and how readily accessible some of the items should be? After all there's no point having a perfect economy if sticks with it long enough to experience it right? Or am I wrong? I want to hear either way!
Just please remember to put at the minimum a simple one word response at least for each number below to help me with my "on paper" research.
If you could just put a simple GOOD or BAD next to the relevant number then that would be excellent. If you wish to elaborate on your point then that's even better but a simple GOOD or BAD will still work wonders for me.
[u]1) Food Shop[/u]
10,000 Noted & Cooked Swordfish, the rest would be fished up by players in order to meet the demands of the players as the server grows.
[u]2) Rune Shop[/u]
50,000 of each "basic" rune (Basic - Fire, Earth, Water, Air, Mind, Chaos, Cosmic, Law, Soul etc.) 10,000 of each "advanced" rune (Advanced - Death, Blood & Astral)
The rest of the runes would be rune crafted by players as demand increases and as the economy grows.
[u]3) Potion Shop[/u]
5,000 of each "basic" potion (Basic - Restores, Strength, Attack, Defence, Ranging, Magic, Prayer, Anti poison etc.) 1,000 of each "advanced" potion (Advanced - Super Restores, Super Strength, Super Attack, Saradomin Brew etc.)
The rest would be made from players through Farming and Herblore.
[u]4) Armour Shop[/u]
1,000 of each piece of "basic" armour (Basic - Bronze -> Rune, Ghostly, Obsidian cloak, possibly dragon? (Skiller's outfits will be in a separate store)
The rest is to be acquired from drops, rewards and of course PLAYERS!
Many thanks and if you have anything at all that you wish to add then I'm all ears!

item.title: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?
item.dc:creator: @Kyle-Billni Kyle-Billni
item.description:
@Kyle-Billni wrote:

To be honest playing a rsps with items/shops handing you everything gets boring, where is the challenge within the game to go make items or try to buy it off other users. How I see it is if you sell lets say dragon armor/armour please won’t need to fight hard monsters (dragons etc) to try and get it which makes it pointless for people to get money gp. I will give you an example, my buddy had just made a server he asked me to join so I did, first account I got 50m, 25 dragon scims, iron scim, iron platelegs,body,full helm,kiteshield, and 5k monks fish, I leveled the basic (att,str,deff,magic,and range) within 3 hours after 4 or 5 I got off and was like why do I want to play anymore since I have everything I want on the game but so does everyone else. I feel like private servers should go back to the good old basics and give users minimal items and make it semi difficult to get an item they always wanted, make it so players want to trade other players for items/goods (I need food) well there are 10 people who like fishing and 4 who likes cooking so boom you got the users who fight (gets items and coins) and buys the food etc from the fishers and cookers. Makes everyone happy and keeps the eco nice and smooth, also don’t make the leveling system crazy other wise people will join on the first day and play 3-4 days and be 99 in certain stats, makes it fun but gets boring fast after you can’t do anything with the levels anymore. I hope this helps in bettering your rsps.

Read full topic
item.source: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?

item.title: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?
item.dc:creator: @Jarker994 Jarker994
item.description:
@Jarker994 wrote:

Elrick:

Happy to educate people on how to run an eco server. I have been disgusted by how many servers claim to be eco and then have absolutely no economy.

This is an excellent point actually, I would say incorporate ways for players to gain feathers such as maybe pickpocketing master farmers or regular?

[size=9pt]I’m very glad people such as yourself and many others are happy to help me with this and I hope to rise to the challenge and meet both the standards I’ve set myself and the standards of the RSPS community. I see your point with pickpocketing and feathers, I’ll certainly take it on board and check what others views are on a similar type of system but I believe there is a need to find a balance between 100% Economy which can be a bore and an economy where you’re given everything immediately. I’m open to debates about this of course as always.[/size]

Davidi2:

It’s been touched on here already, but the key is to give them what they need to get their own stuff. Make sure nobody is going to struggle to get bait, for example. But don’t sell thousands of raw or cooked fish.

[size=9pt]Honestly I don’t mind if the point has been touched on before, there’s always room for another’s opinion on any subject vaguely relating to what I’m asking. So in response to your point -

Yes I certainly do agree with you, I believe what you’ve described there is basically the cornerstone to an economy driven server. So as you may know I’m carrying out a lot of research from a variety of different sources (Forums, Spawn Servers, “Economy” Servers etc.) to see how important an economy is to people.

So far these are the results I’ve gotten when I asked the question “How important is a strong economy on an RSPS to you personally out of 10?”

[spoiler][9\10]
[8\10]
[10\10]
[10\10]
[9\10]
[10\10]
[7\10]
[8\10]
[10\10]
[8\10]
[7\10]
[/spoiler]

[size=9pt]So the message there is very clear, it’s certainly something people want as some of those responses were even taken from people on spawn servers as stated above but I believe there may well be a balance between having a 100% economy server and having everything given to them. I believe that in a nutshell on an RSPS you should give people what they NEED to get what they WANT but not just give them what they WANT immediately.[/size]

[size=10pt]But I cannot do it without you guys so keep the responses coming in please! (Main questionnaire - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,667475.0.html) [/size]

Read full topic

Davidi2:

It’s been touched on here already, but the key is to give them what they need to get their own stuff. Make sure nobody is going to struggle to get bait, for example. But don’t sell thousands of raw or cooked fish.

item.source: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?

item.title: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

No item itself should be accessible in large quantities. If you want to have a good economy based server, don’t make cooked fish/weapons/armours/potion shops with large supply amounts and high tiers. That’s all just ways of being lazy and not ensuring you’re meeting the player’s needs. In the spoiler section is a list of everything I can think of right now that a server needs to be successful. Anything higher than this, especially with a pretty high xp rate, is overkill and unnecessary for a healthy server.
[spoiler]
Fish Monger (ALL UNCOOKED) -
1,000 Shrimp
500 Anchovies
250 Trout
200 Salmon
100 Tuna

Rune Shop -
2,000 Elemental
1,000 Mind & Chaos
500 Death
50 Nature
20 sets of wizard robe sets (boots not included)

Potion Shop -
100 Attack
100 Strength
100 Defense
50,000 Vials of Water
1,000 crates of Vials of Water

Armour Shop -
50 sets of Leather
25 sets of Bronze
25 sets of Iron
20 sets of Steel
15 sets of Mithril
10 sets of Adamant
25 Antifire shield

Melee Shop -
25 Bronze Longsword
25 Iron Longsword
20 Steel Longsword
15 Mithril Longsword
5 Adamant Longsword
25 Bronze Scimitar
25 Iron Scimitar
20 Steel Scimitar
15 Mithril Scimitar
5 Adamant Scimitar
25 Bronze 2h
25 Iron 2h
20 Steel 2h
15 Mithril 2h
5 Adamant 2h

Range Weapon Shop -
1,000 Bronze Arrow
1,000 Iron Arrow
500 Steel Arrow
150 Mithril Arrow
1,000 Bronze Knive
1,000 Iron Knife
500 Steel Knife

Amulet Shop -
100 Amulet of defense
50 amulet of magic
50 amulet of strength
50 amulet of accuracy
10 amulet of power

Equipment -
50 Bronze Hatchet
50 Iron Hatchet
25 Steel Hatchet
20 Mithril Hatchet
10 Adamant Hatchet
1 Runite Hatchet
50 Bronze Pickaxe
50 Iron Pickaxe
25 Steel Pickaxe
20 Mithril Pickaxe
10 Adamant Pickaxe
1 Runite Pickaxe
50 of each farming tool
50 of each crafting tool
50 of each fishing tool
5,000 feathers
5,000 bait
5,000 string
[/spoiler]

Read full topic

item.title: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?
item.dc:creator: @Jarker994 Jarker994
item.description:
@Jarker994 wrote:

Thank you AtomicInt_, you make a lot of very good points there and I’ll definitely be taking them on board; don’t hesitate to get in touch if you have any further thoughts that you wish to share with me.

Keep em’ coming guys!

Read full topic
item.source: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?

item.title: Shop items/amounts for a strong economy?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

For your food shop, don’t offer swordfish. I would offer cakes, pizzas, etc. in limited quantities. Swordfish still have a place and demand to be fished and cooked.

Rune shop? Don’t offer any runes. Slayer, normal monster drops, bossing (for larger quantities of runes) and Runecrafting are all things that need to be utilized.

Armor shop? Basic armor up to adamant, leather, wizard robes, etc are fine, imo. Have other outlets for rune, dragon, dragon hide, etc.

Potions, only offer Strength, Defence and Attack potions. This seems fair as you can get strength for free in RS anyway. The rest should be up to herblore, drops, etc

Read full topic

@Jarker994 wrote:

So I’m working on a server and I am currently in the research stage of this project, I present to you my latest questions which are based around the economy and how readily accessible some of the items should be? After all there’s no point having a perfect economy if sticks with it long enough to experience it right? Or am I wrong? I want to hear either way!
